title: 15 Nordstrom Shoes Trending For Spring, From Jelly Mules to Sandals
description: Between the longer stretches of daylight and yo-yoing weather, a spring shoe refresh can feel essential, and Nordstrom is one of our favorite retailers to start our search. With its vast selection ranging from Nordstrom brands to designer options, it's easy to find a pair that fits your style at a price you're comfortable spending. Plus, newly added fashion brands are often introduced this time of year - hello, Reformation! After poring over the retailer's inventory, we're eyeing all of the shoes we can't wait to slip into. We've honed in on a variety of styles, including sneakers, sandals, and everything in between. If you're ready to give your shoe selection a spring refresh, browse our curated list of Nordstrom's most covetable shoe styles for the season.
author: Angela Elias
excerpt: We rounded up the best women's shoes money can buy at Nordstrom, from water-resistant sandals and cute running shoes to chic mules and more.
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.Between the longer stretches of daylight and yo-yoing weather, a spring shoe refresh can feel essential, and Nordstrom is one of our favorite retailers to start our search. With its vast selection ranging from Nordstrom brands to designer options, it's easy to find a pair that fits your style at a price you're comfortable spending. Plus, newly added fashion brands are often introduced this time of year — hello, Reformation! After poring over the retailer's inventory, we're eyeing all of the shoes we can't wait to slip into. We've honed in on a variety of styles, including sneakers, sandals, and everything in between. If you're ready to give your shoe selection a spring refresh, browse our curated list of Nordstrom's most covetable shoe styles for the season.01nordstrom.comMary Jane FlatsDolce Vita Reyes Mary Jane ($69, originally $120) It seems like red Mary Jane flats are everywhere right now, and this pair is raking in tons of positive reviews. Shoppers are loving how comfortable the leather is and appreciate the modern take of the square toe that reveals just a hint of toe cleavage.02nordstrom.comHeeled SandalsJewel Badgley Mischka Shea Ankle Strap Sandal ($71, originally $119) Whether you have upcoming weddings to attend or just need a fresh pair of heeled sandals for dressier occasions, this option is a stunner. The fabric-wrapped, braided strap and block heel are show-stopping details, while the cushioned footbed and adjustable, rotating ankle strap add comfort.03nordstrom.comWater-Resistant Slide SandalsOluKai Hila Water Resistant Slide Sandal ($85) Whether you have a beach vacation on the books or need a go-to pair of sandals for pool days, this water-resistant option is supportive and practical but elevated. It comes in five color options, but the black feels especially chic and versatile.05nordstrom.comNeutral SneakersAdidas Gazelle Sneaker ($100) A classic that will never go out of style, these Adidas Gazelle sneakers look fabulous with everything from dresses and jeans to sweatsuits with a trench. The pinkish tan hue is also a fantastic neutral if you want to deviate from black and gray.06nordstrom.comSuede SandalsMadewell The Mila Hardware Toe Loop Slide Sandal ($118) Between the soft, cognac suede and sculptural gold hardware, these sandals can instantly elevate a pair of jeans and are perfect for sundresses and even shorts. The low heels are also easy to walk in, especially with the added bonus of the brand's MWL Cloudlift Lite padding.07nordstrom.comCalf Hair BootiesSam Edelman Paige Bootie ($115, originally $170) Between the textured calf hair and leopard print, these booties can easily wake up an all-black outfit or mix with other classic prints, like plaid and pinstripes. The squared toe gives them a bit of modern edge while the stacked block heel makes them comfortable enough to wear to the office.08nordstrom.comPointed FlatsBelle & Bloom On The Go Leather Flat ($150) Every wardrobe needs a pointed flat, but if you want something a bit bolder, the gold chain embellishment and strap have a jewelry-like effect that's perfect for pairing with everything from straight-leg trousers to denim. They come in a range of five different neutral shades, so you can pick a favorite.09nordstrom.comStudded SandalsBirkenstock Arizona Rivets Studded Slide Style ($150) If you gravitate towards the comfort of Birkenstocks but want an option that's more chic than crunchy, their latest Arizona style blends earthy suede with blingy studs. You can grab it in this taupe and silver option or a rust and gold version, depending on your metal preference.10nordstrom.comRunning SneakersOn Cloudtilt Athletic Sneaker ($160) If you're looking for a running shoe that has major cushioning with a lightweight sole, these Cloudtilt sneakers are definitely worth trying. They offer a soft landing, whether you're going for a run, walking, or enjoying a step class. Grab them in this smoky gray and tan palette, or in six other color combinations.11nordstrom.comJelly MulesVince Barcelona Jelly Cage Mule ($198) Jelly shoes are making a comeback for spring, and these Vince beauties strike the perfect balance between laidback comfort and sophisticated. Crafted with a cushioned leather insole and a jelly upper that's soft and pliable, they're a sleek and breezy. There's an assortment of glossy colors to choose from, but we're eyeing this ganache color in particular.12nordstrom.comWestern BootiesMiz Mooz Carlitos Western Bootie ($200) For a soft entry into the Western aesthetic, you can't go wrong with this bootie. It has a stacked heel, tonal stitching, and ankle height. It comes in eight colors, ranging from neutrals to bold colors, but we love this Brandy hue.13nordstrom.comKnee-High BootsSam Edelman Sylvia Knee High Boot ($200) Sexy and elegant, we're picturing wearing these knee-high boots with everything from dresses and skirts to barrel-leg pants. They come in several different leather options, as well as this gorgeous suede styles.14nordstrom.comSheer MulesReformation Wilda Pointed Toe Kitten Mule ($278) Whether you're wearing them with your favorite pair of jeans or a sundress, these sheer mules will be the focal point. Between the angled kitten heel and the mesh, flower-adorned toe bed, they're dainty yet supportive and a must have for spring.15nordstrom.comPleated BootiesNeil J. Rodgers Plisse Ankle Boots ($895) Neil J. Rodgers recently became available at Nordstrom, and we're eyeing these pleated ankle boots. The shape and color is versatile enough to be worn with practically anything, but the individually hand-folded pleats crafted from soft Italian leather also make a statement. They're selling quickly, so snag them in your size before they're gone!-Angela Elias (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping, where she reviews everything from beauty products to kitchen gadgets, curates can't-miss sales, and creates "best of" shopping roundups. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Between the longer stretches of daylight and yo-yoing weather, a spring shoe refresh can feel essential, and Nordstrom is one of our favorite retailers to start our search. With its vast selection ranging from Nordstrom brands to designer options, it's easy to find a pair that fits your style at a price you're comfortable spending. Plus, newly added fashion brands are often introduced this time of year — hello, Reformation! After poring over the retailer's inventory, we're eyeing all of the shoes we can't wait to slip into. We've honed in on a variety of styles, including sneakers, sandals, and everything in between. If you're ready to give your shoe selection a spring refresh, browse our curated list of Nordstrom's most covetable shoe styles for the season.

01

Mary Jane Flats

Dolce Vita Reyes Mary Jane ($69, originally $120)

It seems like red Mary Jane flats are everywhere right now, and this pair is raking in tons of positive reviews. Shoppers are loving how comfortable the leather is and appreciate the modern take of the square toe that reveals just a hint of toe cleavage.

02

Heeled Sandals

Jewel Badgley Mischka Shea Ankle Strap Sandal ($71, originally $119)

Whether you have upcoming weddings to attend or just need a fresh pair of heeled sandals for dressier occasions, this option is a stunner. The fabric-wrapped, braided strap and block heel are show-stopping details, while the cushioned footbed and adjustable, rotating ankle strap add comfort.

03

Water-Resistant Slide Sandals

OluKai Hila Water Resistant Slide Sandal ($85)

Whether you have a beach vacation on the books or need a go-to pair of sandals for pool days, this water-resistant option is supportive and practical but elevated. It comes in five color options, but the black feels especially chic and versatile.

05

Neutral Sneakers

Adidas Gazelle Sneaker ($100)

A classic that will never go out of style, these Adidas Gazelle sneakers look fabulous with everything from dresses and jeans to sweatsuits with a trench. The pinkish tan hue is also a fantastic neutral if you want to deviate from black and gray.

06

Suede Sandals

Madewell The Mila Hardware Toe Loop Slide Sandal ($118)

Between the soft, cognac suede and sculptural gold hardware, these sandals can instantly elevate a pair of jeans and are perfect for sundresses and even shorts. The low heels are also easy to walk in, especially with the added bonus of the brand's MWL Cloudlift Lite padding.

07

Calf Hair Booties

Sam Edelman Paige Bootie ($115, originally $170)

Between the textured calf hair and leopard print, these booties can easily wake up an all-black outfit or mix with other classic prints, like plaid and pinstripes. The squared toe gives them a bit of modern edge while the stacked block heel makes them comfortable enough to wear to the office.

08

Pointed Flats

Belle & Bloom On The Go Leather Flat ($150)

Every wardrobe needs a pointed flat, but if you want something a bit bolder, the gold chain embellishment and strap have a jewelry-like effect that's perfect for pairing with everything from straight-leg trousers to denim. They come in a range of five different neutral shades, so you can pick a favorite.

09

Studded Sandals

Birkenstock Arizona Rivets Studded Slide Style ($150)

If you gravitate towards the comfort of Birkenstocks but want an option that's more chic than crunchy, their latest Arizona style blends earthy suede with blingy studs. You can grab it in this taupe and silver option or a rust and gold version, depending on your metal preference.

10

Running Sneakers

On Cloudtilt Athletic Sneaker ($160)

If you're looking for a running shoe that has major cushioning with a lightweight sole, these Cloudtilt sneakers are definitely worth trying. They offer a soft landing, whether you're going for a run, walking, or enjoying a step class. Grab them in this smoky gray and tan palette, or in six other color combinations.

11

Jelly Mules

Vince Barcelona Jelly Cage Mule ($198)

Jelly shoes are making a comeback for spring, and these Vince beauties strike the perfect balance between laidback comfort and sophisticated. Crafted with a cushioned leather insole and a jelly upper that's soft and pliable, they're a sleek and breezy. There's an assortment of glossy colors to choose from, but we're eyeing this ganache color in particular.

12

Western Booties

Miz Mooz Carlitos Western Bootie ($200)

For a soft entry into the Western aesthetic, you can't go wrong with this bootie. It has a stacked heel, tonal stitching, and ankle height. It comes in eight colors, ranging from neutrals to bold colors, but we love this Brandy hue.

13

Knee-High Boots

Sam Edelman Sylvia Knee High Boot ($200)

Sexy and elegant, we're picturing wearing these knee-high boots with everything from dresses and skirts to barrel-leg pants. They come in several different leather options, as well as this gorgeous suede styles.

14

Sheer Mules

Reformation Wilda Pointed Toe Kitten Mule ($278)

Whether you're wearing them with your favorite pair of jeans or a sundress, these sheer mules will be the focal point. Between the angled kitten heel and the mesh, flower-adorned toe bed, they're dainty yet supportive and a must have for spring.

15

Pleated Booties

Neil J. Rodgers Plisse Ankle Boots ($895)

Neil J. Rodgers recently became available at Nordstrom, and we're eyeing these pleated ankle boots. The shape and color is versatile enough to be worn with practically anything, but the individually hand-folded pleats crafted from soft Italian leather also make a statement. They're selling quickly, so snag them in your size before they're gone!

Angela Elias (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping, where she reviews everything from beauty products to kitchen gadgets, curates can't-miss sales, and creates "best of" shopping roundups. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.
